column3: A youth, when at home, should be filial and, abroad, respectful to his elders. He should be earnest and truthful. He should overflow in love to all and cultivate the friendship of the good. When he has time and opportunity, after the performance of these things, he should employ them in polite studies.
To all the other dreamers out there, don't ever stop or let the world's negativity disenchant you or your spirit. If you surround yourself with love and the right people, anything is possible.

I spent a lot of years trying to outrun or outsmart vulnerability by making things certain and definite, black and white, good and bad. My inability to lean into the discomfort of vulnerability limited the fullness of those important experiences that are wrought with uncertainty: Love, belonging, trust, joy, and creativity to name a few.

One look at an email can rob you of 15 minutes of focus. One call on your cell phone, one tweet, one instant message can destroy your schedule, forcing you to move meetings, or blow off really important things, like love, and friendship.
To know yourself as the Being underneath the thinker, the stillness underneath the mental noise, the love and joy underneath the pain, is freedom, salvation, enlightenment.
You protect your being when you love yourself better. That's the secret.
Treasure the love you receive above all. It will survive long after your good health has vanished.
Love is a serious mental disease.
A coward is incapable of exhibiting love; it is the prerogative of the brave.
Accept what people offer. Drink their milkshakes. Take their love.
There is only one real deprivation... and that is not to be able to give one's gifts to those one loves most.
Though lovers be lost love shall not.
Love will draw an elephant through a key-hole.
If you find someone you love in your life, then hang on to that love.
Love cures people - both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.
I long for the raised voice, the howl of rage or love.
There's a big difference between falling in love with someone and falling in love with someone and getting married. Usually, after you get married, you fall in love with the person even more.
Happiness, for me, is a function of the number of people I love, and I think joy and happiness is directly related to how many people are in our lives and how deeply we are bonded with those people.
I'd love to romance Aishwarya Rai. But I'm 58 now. So I have to play her father.
I do love to eavesdrop. It's inspirational, not only for subject matter but for actual dialogue, the way people talk.
I only watch National Geographic Channel, and also I have the app on my phone. I'm into astronomy and love to learn about new facts.
A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
The giving of love is an education in itself.
The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.
Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.
